With the world of gaming ever evolving and growing, Microsoft is one of the major players in the industry. Microsoft owns a number of video game companies, which range from first-party developers to publishers and more. In this article, we’ll explore what video game companies Microsoft owns and how they fit into the broader gaming landscape.

What Video Game Companies Does Microsoft Own?

Microsoft is one of the world’s leading technology companies, with a wide portfolio of products and services. As part of its expansion into the video game market, Microsoft has acquired a number of game studios, including some of the most successful and influential developers and publishers in the industry.

Microsoft has invested heavily in the video game market and has acquired a number of major studios and companies. These acquisitions include: Rare Ltd., Lionhead Studios, Mojang AB, Double Fine Entertainment, and Obsidian Entertainment. Microsoft has also acquired a number of smaller game development companies, such as Ninja Theory and Undead Labs.

What is Rare Ltd.?

Rare Ltd. is a British video game development company founded in 1985 by Tim and Chris Stamper. The company is best known for its critically acclaimed and commercially successful games, such as GoldenEye 007, Perfect Dark, Banjo-Kazooie, and Conker’s Bad Fur Day. Rare Ltd. was acquired by Microsoft in 2002 and has since released games exclusively for Microsoft’s Xbox and Windows platforms.

What is Lionhead Studios?

Lionhead Studios is a British video game development studio founded in 1996 by Peter Molyneux. The company is best known for its Fable franchise of action role-playing games, as well as its Black & White and The Movies franchises. Lionhead Studios was acquired by Microsoft in 2006 and has since released games exclusively for Microsoft’s Xbox and Windows platforms.

What is Mojang AB?

Mojang AB is a Swedish video game development company founded in 2009 by Markus Persson. The company is best known for its sandbox game Minecraft, which has sold more than 180 million copies worldwide. Mojang AB was acquired by Microsoft in 2014 and has since released games exclusively for Microsoft’s Xbox, Windows, and mobile platforms.

What is Double Fine Entertainment?

Double Fine Entertainment is an American video game development studio founded in 2000 by Tim Schafer. The company is best known for its critically acclaimed adventure games, such as Psychonauts and Broken Age. Double Fine Entertainment was acquired by Microsoft in 2019 and has since released games exclusively for Microsoft’s Xbox and Windows platforms.

What is Obsidian Entertainment?

Obsidian Entertainment is an American video game development studio founded in 2003 by Feargus Urquhart. The company is best known for its role-playing games, such as Pillars of Eternity and Fallout: New Vegas. Obsidian Entertainment was acquired by Microsoft in 2018 and has since released games exclusively for Microsoft’s Xbox and Windows platforms.

What is Ninja Theory?

Ninja Theory is a British video game development studio founded in 2004 by Tameem Antoniades and Nina Kristensen. The company is best known for its action-adventure games, such as Hellblade: Senua’s Sacrifice and DmC: Devil May Cry. Ninja Theory was acquired by Microsoft in 2018 and has since released games exclusively for Microsoft’s Xbox and Windows platforms.

What is Undead Labs?

Undead Labs is an American video game development studio founded in 2009 by Jeff Strain. The company is best known for its zombie survival game State of Decay, which has sold more than 10 million copies worldwide. Undead Labs was acquired by Microsoft in 2018 and has since released games exclusively for Microsoft’s Xbox and Windows platforms.

What Games Have Been Developed by Microsoft Studios?

Microsoft Studios is the video game publishing arm of Microsoft. The company has developed and published a number of critically acclaimed and commercially successful games, such as Halo, Gears of War, Forza Motorsport, and Sea of Thieves. Microsoft Studios has also developed a number of smaller games and mobile titles, such as Age of Empires: Castle Siege, Zombie Driver: Immortal Edition, and Minecraft Dungeons.

What Other Video Game Companies Does Microsoft Own?

In addition to the major studios and companies mentioned above, Microsoft has also acquired a number of smaller game development companies. These include Compulsion Games, Playground Games, inXile Entertainment, and Ninja Theory. Microsoft has also acquired the rights to a number of franchises, such as Age of Empires, Forza Horizon, and Gears of War.

What Platforms Are Supported by Microsoft’s Video Game Companies?

Microsoft’s video game companies support a wide range of platforms, including Microsoft’s Xbox and Windows platforms, as well as mobile platforms such as iOS and Android. Microsoft’s games are also available on other platforms, such as the PlayStation 4 and Nintendo Switch, through third-party publishing agreements.
